newsitem.title: PERU: Peru's Fujimori announces new tariff, tax measures.
newsitem.headline: Peru's Fujimori announces new tariff, tax measures.

text.p: Peru President Alberto Fujimori announced late Friday the replacement of a 1.5 percent minimum tax on assets with a flat 0.5 percent assets tax and a reduction in tariffs to an average of 13 percent.

"The government is offering to substitute the current minimum income tax of 1.5 percent on the value of assets, with a tax on assets of 0.5 percent of their value," Fujimori told a conference of economists.
Fujimori said the new tax scheme would reduce companies' tax burden and inject $150 million into the economy. The new levy could be set against income tax, he said.

Fujimori also announced a reduction in tariffs to two levels of 20 percent and 12 percent. "This reduces our average tariffs from 16 to 13 percent which compares favorably with levels of 11 and 12 percent in Chile, Brazil and Argentina," he said.
Fujimori said the reduction in tariffs was aimed at improving the Peruvian economy's competitiveness so that exports could grow at a target rate of 15 percent per year.
